title: Maggie L Walker National Historic Site: Plan Your Visit
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit           Plan Your Visit        Walker’s “urban mansion” in Richmond, Virginia served as a social hub and family sanctuary to four generations. NPS Photo         Basic Information Welcome to the home of Maggie Lena Walker, bank president, fraternal leader, and national activist! To tour Walker's home and an exhibit area, begin your visit at the park's visitor center at 600 North 2nd Street, Richmond VA 23219.  Tours are free and are offered on a first come, first serve basis. Visitors should allow at least 60 minutes to tour the site.   Reservations are required for groups larger than 10 and for school groups. Directions & Transportation Maggie L. Walker National Historic site is located at 600 North 2nd Street, Richmond VA 23219 in the Jackson Ward neighborhood. Free street parking is available on 2nd Street. Things To Do Tour Maggie Walker's home, explore Jackson Ward or become a Junior Ranger! Calendar Check out the park's upcoming events and special programs. Safety Follow these tips for a safe and enjoyable park experience. Accessibility Information about accessibility for wheelchair users.
